title: Shocking CCTV footage shows brazen burglars trying to break into a London home
text:
This is the moment a serial burglar was caught trying to break into a south London home while a woman was watching TV inside.

Prolific criminal Jack Jones, 20, and a masked accomplice were filmed trying the lock of the Croydon property before giving up - apparently unaware a camera was pointed directly at their faces.

Days later Jones and his partner were picked up by another security camera as he climbed over the garden gate of a nearby home.

But while the second burglar covered up his face, confident Jones chose not to, allowing detectives to quickly identify him. He was later arrested.

Prolific criminal Jack Jones, 20, pictured, and a masked accomplice were filmed brazenly walking into the property in Croydon, south London, in January last year

While the second burglar covered up his face a confident Jack Jones chose not to, allowing detectives to quickly identify him. Pictured, Jones on his arrest in Clapham, south London

The shocking footage was shown on last night's episode The Met: Policing London, which followed DC Martin O'Neil and his team as they tried to track down Jones and his unidentified accomplice.

DC O'Neil was called to the scene following the attempted home break-in in January last year.

The female homeowner showed the police officer footage taken from two different security cameras installed in the property.

The female homeowner showed the police officer footage taken from two different security cameras installed in the property. The first saw the men (just seen right) approaching

The second camera, positioned inside the vestibule, was pointed directly at the door and captured Jones - whose face was uncovered - as he walked inside, pictured

The homeowner, pictured, described Jones and his accomplice's behaviour as 'casual' and said they 'knew what they were doing'. The woman was watching TV inside at the time

The first captured Jones and his accomplice walking towards one of the doors after finding a set of keys inside a van outside.

The second camera, positioned inside the vestibule, was pointed directly at the door and captured Jones - whose face was uncovered - as he walked inside.

'Luckily, when you walk in, the lights come on,' the homeowner explained. 'You can see his full face. He wasn't rushing. They were quite casual, they knew what they were doing.'

Days later Jones and his partner were picked up by another security camera as he climbed over the garden gate of a nearby home. Pictured, Jones 'shushing' his accomplice outside

Jones, who had long been wanted by police, was interviewed in last night's episode of The Met: Policing London. Jones was arrested after police pulled over his car in south London

Jones, pictured after his arrest, pleaded guilty to three offences of attempted burglary. He was sentenced to 12 months in a young offenders' institution

She added: 'I was watching TV but I didn't hear anything. That was the scary bit. When we watched it back and we saw them actually trying to get into the house.'

Officers were immediately able to identify Jones - who was wanted in connection with other crimes - but struggled to track him down.

Jones and his girlfriend were pulled over after police recognised his car and pulled him over in Clapham, south London.

Jones pleaded guilty to three offences of attempted burglary. He was sentenced to 12 months in a young offenders' institution.

The Met: Policing London returns next Thursday at 9pm on BBC1
description: Prolific criminal Jack Jones, 20, and a masked accomplice were filmed trying the lock of the south London property before giving up - apparently unaware a camera was pointed directly at his face.
